{"step_by_step_thinking": "Based on the patient's history and physical examination findings, it is likely that she is suffering from bulimia nervosa. The enlarged cheeks and calluses on the dorsum of her hands are consistent with the physical manifestations of self-induced vomiting. Bulimia nervosa is an eating disorder characterized by recurrent episodes of binge eating followed by compensatory behaviors such as self-induced vomiting, excessive exercise, or the use of laxatives. One of the common complications of bulimia nervosa is erosion of tooth enamel due to the repeated exposure of the teeth to stomach acid during vomiting.
